artifact.content: Each phone uses the same API.
Server/phone subsystem communication must occur over sockets.
Users are able to both send and receive calls.
System must monitor each phone for events.
The number of current calls must be recorded.
Must construct and maintain a mapping from dialed numbers to IP addresses.
Phone/IP mapping must be accessible to call processing and admin software
Phone numbers are 4 digits long.
System console has a GUI.
Administrators log into system console using a login name and password.
All phone calls must go through the server.
All administrators have the same privileges.
Only have to support one admin at a time at the system console
Administrative functions need to be atomic incase se support more than one administrator in the future.
Must check for errors in administrator console input.
Administrator is able to make, edit, and delete use accounts.
Administrator can search for free phone numbers and IPs.
Canceling a user�s service involves dissociating the IP address, phone number, and user account.
User records should be stored indefinitely.
System console displays hardware status info such as our of service phones.
Administrators may request hardware tests at any time.
System console must be able to receive error messages.
System console must alert administrator of errors.
System will monitor all phone processes and run test to verify normal operation.
The automatic hardware detection needs to detect that a phone has become unresponsive
Unresponsive phones must be released to prevent resource leak.
The administrator must have to ability to reset the call processing on any phone.
When a user places a call, check if reached max number of calls.
The system needs to be able to gracefully recover to some default state.
Cost of a call depends on num. dialed, duration, when established, and call plan.
Must keep a record of each call: caller, destination number, and duration.
Each customer is sent a bill via email.
System console can display each user�s bill on the screen.
The user�s bill shows each call, each call�s time and cost, and the total cost.
Bills are immediately issued if user�s service is cancelled.
Bill payments are recorded by administrator using the system console.
When a user misses a payment, a warning shows up on next bill.
Administrator can change fees by adjusting existing billing plan or creating a new one.
Administrator can change a user�s billing plan.
Changes to a user�s billing plan take place immediately.
Must be able to scale to a very large number of phones.
Call has higher priority over administrative software.
Show system load to the administrator in the console.
Special error tone to let the caller know there are no resources available.
The administrator should be able to suspend accounts if payment is overdue.
The administrator can resume a user�s account that has been suspended
Performance of the phones and server is very important. Want them to be fast.
Want the console to be easy for the administrator to use.
Need to phones and server to be efficient in use of resources.
Very important for the entire system to be reliable
Would like the system to be easily testable for when it comes time to test.
